nodes.description: 2004年9月，所有与案件“本地联系”有关的嫌疑人，包括多名布宜诺斯艾利斯省警察，均被宣告无罪。
nodes.support_text: All suspects in the "local connection" (among them, many members of the Buenos Aires Provincial Police) were found to be not guilty in September 2004.

nodes.description: 2005年，时任布宜诺斯艾利斯总主教贝尔戈利奥（后来的教皇方济各）签署请愿书，呼吁为AMIA案伸张正义。
nodes.support_text: In 2005, Cardinal Jorge Mario Bergoglio, who would later become Pope Francis, was the first public personality to sign a petition for justice in the AMIA bombing case.

nodes.description: 2005年8月，联邦法官加莱亚诺因在调查中存在“严重”违规行为而被弹劾并免职。
nodes.support_text: In August 2005, federal judge Juan José Galeano, in charge of the case, was impeached and removed from his post on a charge of "serious" irregularities due to mishandling of the investigation.

nodes.description: 2006年10月，阿根廷检察官正式指控伊朗政府策划了爆炸案，并指示真主党组织实施。
nodes.support_text: On 25 October 2006, Argentine prosecutors Alberto Nisman and Marcelo Martínez Burgos formally accused the government of Iran of directing the bombing, and the Hezbollah militia of carrying it out.

nodes.description: 调查人员从未找到任何关于伊朗责任的证据。
nodes.support_text: They never came up with anything.

nodes.description: Moatamer曾声称自己拥有政府决策的知识。
nodes.support_text: Moatamer claimed to have the knowledge of government decision-making.

nodes.description: Moatamer最终被证明只是一个心怀不满的低级官员。
nodes.support_text: Moatamer turned out to be a dissatisfied low-ranking official.

nodes.description: Cheek和他的团队最终决定Moatamer是不可信的。
nodes.support_text: We finally decided that he wasn't credible.

nodes.description: James Cheek告诉作者，没有关于伊朗责任的任何真实证据。
nodes.support_text: James Cheek told him that there was never any real evidence of Iranian responsibility.

nodes.description: Cheek回忆起该案中最有价值的线索是伊朗叛逃者Moatamer。
nodes.support_text: Cheek recalled that the hottest lead in the case was an Iranian defector, Moatamer.

nodes.description: Cheek回忆起他们最终决定Moatamer不可信。
nodes.support_text: Cheek recalled, 'We finally decided that he wasn't credible'.

nodes.description: 作者声称James Cheek曾告诉他关于证据和Moatamer的情况。
nodes.support_text: The author claims James Cheek told him about the lack of evidence and the Moatamer affair.
